content.description: SDS on a good rail, and move into a crimpy seam. Hit the lip, and bump to a sloped pocket that you can't see. Make your way right to a pair of glory jugs, and throw a heel hook up. Carefully balance your way over the lip using awful sloped dishes and friction. Top out the slab.
content.protection: Pads. The crux move to the pocket is easily protected, but botching the mantel at the end could send you a long ways downhill. The best time to do this line would be when the water level is right below the sit start ledge.
content.location:
This is directly between

Barrel Rider

and

Impish Joe

on the bay-facing side of the rock.

content.description: Start on the lowest holds with a left hand sloper and a right hand sidepull, slap up your right hand to a three finger mini-incut, then bump your left hand in to a meaty pinch, and easily compress to the top.
content.location: This is across the reservoir from the Black Wall right on the water.

content.description: On the low left side of the boulder close to the water is this good compression problem. Begin crouched with a left hand rail and small right hand crimp. Use some heel/toe trickery to pull on and move up and left, traversing the arete left to top out. The landing is underwater most of summer.
content.location: This ascends the left side of boulder starting in small cave.
